intro: Drymoglossum metacoelum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that are often slightly curled at the edges. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. It has a dense, mat-forming growth habit and is often found in temperate regions. The plant plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
